markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Pucker Pickle](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1927)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Alchemical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=6" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Poison" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=126" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 50 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Price** 30 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Sharp and pungent, but tasty, pucker pickles were created by [goblin](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=4) [alchemists](/Classes.aspx?ID=1) working to avoid being eaten by larger creatures. For 1 hour after eating a pucker pickle, you smell slightly of pickle, but you have a horrendous taste. Once a creature hits you with a Strike using an attack that allows it to taste you, such as a jaws Strike, it takes a –2 circumstance penalty to further attacks against you that allow it to taste you, including attacks like [Grappling](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) or [Tripping](/Actions.aspx?ID=40) you using its jaws or [Swallowing you Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35). Creatures, especially [animals](/Traits.aspx?ID=9), often choose other targets after tasting you. Any creature that [Engulfs](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=14) you or Swallows you Whole is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34). If it spends an action retching to reduce the sickened condition, you can attempt to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) as a reaction.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Pucker Pickle
